recipe: Fill a large pot with water and heat over high while you do other prep. Season with {1; handful; kosher salt}.
Peel and finely chop {1; ; yellow onion}.
Firmly smash {4; cloves; garlic} with the flat side of a knife and peel. Leave cloves whole and partially smashed.
Heat {2; tablespoon; extra virgin olive oil} over medium heat in a heavy-bottomed pot.
Add onions and garlic and cook 5 to 7 minutes until onion edges start to brown.
Add {4.5; ounce; double-concentrated tomato paste} and {0.5; teaspoon; dried red pepper flakes} and stir until paste evenly coats onion.
Cook for 5 to 7 minutes while stirring often until tomato paste is deep red and starting to brown on the bottom of the pot.
Add {2; ounce; vodka} to deglaze pan and scrape the bottom with a wooden spoon.
Scoop {0.25; cup; water} from the boiling pasta pot and combine with {0.75; cup; heavy cream} in a heat-proof cup. Wait a minute or so until the mixture is warm.
Add warmed cream to the dutch oven, stirring to incorporate into the sauce.
Add {1; pound; rigatoni pasta} to pot and cook normally. Remember to reserve some pasta water if you want.
Once done, scoop cooked pasta from the pot into the dutch oven. Best to scoop so that some water comes with it.
Add {4; ounce; parmesan cheese} and stir to melt cheese and coat pasta with sauce. Add a bit of pasta water if the sauce is too thick.
